channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Coronavirus has devastated Moscow. Now it's spreading across Russia's 11 time zones to ill-funded regions
item.description: Russia hit a grim Covid-19 milestone this week: According to Johns Hopkins University, the country now ranks second in the world for confirmed coronavirus cases.

item.title: The latest on the coronavirus from around the world
CNN anchor to Trump official: This is nothing to celebrate
item.description: CNN's Jake Tapper presses Health and Human Services Secretary Alex Azar about the high death toll in the US from Covid-19.

item.title: Lack of immunity means China is vulnerable to another wave of coronavirus, top adviser warns
item.description: China still faces the "big challenge" of a potential second wave of Covid-19 infections, the country's top respiratory authority has warned, with the lack of immunity among the community a serious concern as the race to develop a vaccine continues.

item.title: A Canadian Snowbirds aircraft has crashed in British Columbia
item.description: A Canadian Forces Snowbirds aircraft crashed near Kamloops, British Columbia, on Sunday, according to the Canadian Department of National Defence.

item.title: Chinese ambassador to Israel is found dead in his home, Foreign Ministry says
item.description: The Chinese ambassador to Israel, Du Wei, was found dead Sunday morning inside his official residence north of Tel Aviv.

item.title: Bayern sinks minnow Union Berlin on Bundesliga resumption
item.description: It was set to be the greatest day in the history of Bundesliga minnow Union Berlin, but instead it was business for usual for seven-time defending champion Bayern Munich and top goalscorer Robert Lewandowski.

item.title: Man alone at sea for 3 months emerges to a changed world
item.description: After spending months alone at sea, Canadian sailor Bill Norrie arrived in Christchurch, New Zealand, to find the world completely changed by the coronavirus pandemic. CNN affiliate TVNZ reports.

item.title: Pompeo backs away from theory he and Trump were pushing that coronavirus originated in Wuhan lab
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo appears to be backing away from a theory he and President Donald Trump were pushing that the coronavirus pandemic may have originated at a lab in Wuhan, China.

item.title: Health officials double down on the dangers of mass gatherings as US states reopen
item.description: Just as more Americans are allowed to visit beaches, attend church indoors or eat inside a restaurant, health officials say gathering in large groups could send states back to where they started.

item.title: The US relies on India for generic drugs. But China controls that supply chain
item.description: Sarah Thebarge, a 41-year-old physician assistant living in San Francisco, takes a pill every day to treat her lupus, a chronic condition that causes unbearable joint pain, fatigue and fainting spells.

item.title: Bids for rock legend's guitar start at $1M
item.description: A guitar Kurt Cobain played during Nirvana's 'MTV Unplugged in New York' live concert could sell for $1 million.

item.title: The dangerous consequences of Trump's oversight purge
While Obama calls out 'so-called grown-ups,' Trump administration takes a victory lap
item.description: Barack Obama's harsh criticism of the Trump administration's handling of the coronavirus pandemic this weekend brought renewed scrutiny of President Donald Trump's leadership, but administration officials defended the response as "historic" Sunday as deaths neared 90,000.

item.title: The privacy intrusions of 9/11 may pale compared with what's coming
What used to be a 5-hour trip now takes an entire day. This is why
item.description: A location-tracking wristband, mandatory testing upon arrival, one-time hotel entry key cards. CNN's Will Ripley shows us Hong Kong's new strict protocols for travelers arriving from abroad.

item.title: Covid-19 offers a chance to build a better world. We must seize it.
item.description: The coronavirus alone didn't itself break our world. It just exposed a world that was already breaking.

item.title: State polls suggest Biden has a clear national lead
item.description: Poll of the week: A new Marquette Law School poll finds former Vice President Joe Biden with a 46% to 43% lead over President Donald Trump in Wisconsin.

item.title: Protesters harass local reporter during a reopening rally
item.description: News 12 Long Island reporter Kevin Vesey was covering a reopening when protesters harassed and insulted him, and some invaded his personal space while refusing to wear a mask.

item.title: Snoop Dogg uses 'Frozen' to encourage people to 'let it go' -- and Idina Menzel responds
item.description: No matter his fame and notoriety, rapper Snoop Dogg proved that he's just like the rest of us -- he, too, sometimes needs to jam out to music in his car to relieve stress. But his choice of music might surprise you.

item.title: Michael Jordan's signature Air Jordan shoes from 1985 sell for record-breaking price, Sotheby's says
item.description: A pair of Michael Jordan's game-worn shoes from 1985 sold for more than three times the estimated auction price on Sunday, breaking the world auction record for sneakers, according to Sotheby's.

item.title: Questions surround Mexico's reported Covid-19 death toll
item.description: Mexico has announced plans to reopen the country even as the reported number of coronavirus cases and deaths have been called into question. CNN's Matt Rivers reports

item.title: Tropical Storm Arthur forms in the Atlantic
item.description: Two weeks before the official start to Atlantic hurricane season, Tropical Storm Arthur has become the first named storm of the year.

item.title: Cornered by the coronavirus, Trump returns to a familiar strategy: Attack Obama
item.description: With the death count from the coronavirus rising and its economic fallout deepening, President Donald Trump is trying to fire up his base and divert the national conversation by promoting a baseless conspiracy that casts his predecessor, Barack Obama, as the architect of a plot to subvert his presidency.

item.title: Emptied out by Covid-19, Italy's canal city plots ways to keep crowds of tourists from ever returning
item.description: A few days before Italy is set to lift restrictions across much of the country after being locked down since March 10, the streets of Venice are starting to spring back to life.

item.title: Black light experiment shows how quickly a virus spreads
item.description: Contact tracing is becoming increasingly important in containing the spread of the coronavirus as states push to re-open. CNN's Tom Foreman has more.

item.title: Olympic athletes keep hope alive as coronavirus puts dreams on hold
item.description: "Go There" is a deeper look at the cultural, political and economic challenges affecting our lives. We're going to take you to the center of the story alongside our correspondents across the globe. Episodes premiere weekdays at 8 p.m. ET on Facebook. Check out some of our recent content below.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios lets fly at Novak Djokovic in lockdown chat
item.description: After downing what he thought was about six glasses of wine, a tipsy looking Nick Kyrgios told good friend Andy Murray that he thought the former Wimbledon champion was better than Novak Djokovic.

item.title: Germany's Bundesliga marks soccer's elite return, with changes
item.description: It wasn't soccer as we usually know it but games were finally played again on Saturday in Germany, bringing high-profile sporting competition back during the coronavirus pandemic.

item.title: Ikea's instructions for building the best pillow forts are what every parent needs right now
item.description: After what feels like a lifetime in quarantine and isolation, parents may be running out of ideas to keep kids entertained.

item.title: Rwandan genocide suspect captured in Paris suburb after decades on the run
item.description: One of the last key suspects in the Rwandan genocide has been captured in a Paris suburb after more than 20 years on the run.

item.title: Denmark's Noma restaurant turns into burger bar
Edvard Munch's masterpiece The Scream is fading. New research has found out why
item.description: Over the last few decades, an unseen enemy has been degrading The Scream. The famous painting by Edvard Munch represents human anxiety and anguish and feels especially relevant during these uncertain times.

item.title: Two Sikh doctors shaved their beards, a pillar of their religion, to treat Covid-19 patients
item.description: Two Canadian doctors of the Sikh faith have made the difficult decision to shave off their beards -- a pillar of their faith -- to continue treating Covid-19 patients.

item.title: She had to give birth while in a coma. Five weeks later, she's finally met her baby
item.description: Alicia Kappers doesn't remember her contractions or her baby's first cries. Other than her newborn son, her only reminder of that day is the scar from her cesarean section.

item.title: Preschools and childcare might reopen soon. Should you send your kid?
item.description: Last week I received an email from my younger son's preschool.

item.title: Will audiences go back to movie theaters after the pandemic ends?
item.description: More and more movies once destined for the big screen are going on-demand while theaters are closed due to the pandemic. Here's what will and will not change about moviegoing because of Covid-19.

item.title: Tourist arrested in Hawaii after posting beach pictures on Instagram
item.description: A tourist from New York was arrested in Hawaii after he posted beach pictures on Instagram when he was supposed to be in quarantine.

item.title: Mystery behind the construction of earliest known temple revealed
item.description: Researchers have discovered part of the mystery behind the construction of the earliest known temple in human history.

item.title: Mom makes a wild contraption so grandma can hug kids
item.description: Kids hug grandma through plastic. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports on a hugging contraption.

item.title: Dear Grandma, read this before you visit the little ones
item.description: Dear Grandma,

item.title: 'Beating hearts' of these pulsating stars create music to astronomers' ears
item.description: Stars may appear bright to us on Earth, but peering inside their hearts is a little more elusive. Star data from NASA's planet-hunting TESS mission has helped an international team of scientists detect patterns in 60 pulsating stars.

item.title: Baby elephant born at the Houston Zoo survives emergency surgery
item.description: It's a boy!

item.title: Prestigious British flower show goes virtual
item.description: Horticultural enthusiasts will be able to take a virtual tour of award-winning designers' gardens when Britain's famous Chelsea Flower Show goes online later this month for the first time in its history.

item.title: 180 people exposed by one person at church service
item.description: A person who later learned they were positive for Covid-19 attended a California religious service on Mother's Day, exposing 180 other people to the novel coronavirus, according to local health officials.

item.title: South Africa reports highest daily total of virus cases
Social distancing could wipe out the restaurant industry
item.description: The US state of Georgia allowed restaurants to reopen on April 27. The three owned by Ryan Pernice are still shuttered.

item.title: Trump's pivot to economy leaves leadership vacuum on US pandemic response
Obama's Covid-19 commencement speech
item.description: Former President Barack Obama told college graduates that the "folks in charge" don't always know what they're doing in rare public criticism of the Trump administration.

item.title: Three countries have already defaulted on their debt this year. These may be next
item.description: This is no time to be a country that relies heavily on tourism to keep its economy going. Combine that with a huge debt load and weak fiscal policies, and that's a recipe for financial disaster.
